javadoc:
A component that acts as the general purpose glass pane for Java windows.  This component allows
 Ghidra to easily change

methods.javadoc:
Default constructor.

NOTE: You must call {@link #setVisible( true )} on this component after adding it to the component. This is because the component will set the visibility to that of the previous glass pane, which is false by default.
methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Default constructor.
 
 NOTE: You must call } on this component after adding it
 to the component.  This is because the component will set the visibility to that of
 the previous glass pane, which is false by default.

methods.name: addPainter
methods.comment:
Adds a painter that will be called when this pane's #paintComponent(Graphics) 
 method is called.

methods.javadoc: When set busy is called, a busy cursor will be displayed and all user mouse and keyboard events will be blocked. @param isBusy True to block events and show the busy cursor; false to restore events and to restore the default cursor.
methods.name: setBusy
methods.comment:
When set busy is called, a busy cursor will be displayed and all user mouse and 
 keyboard events will be blocked.

params.name: isBusy
params.comment:
True to block events and show the busy cursor; false to restore events and
               to restore the default cursor.

methods.javadoc: Sets the busy state of all glass panes created in the VM.
methods.name: setAllGlassPanesBusy
methods.comment: Sets the busy state of all glass panes created in the VM.

methods.javadoc: Returns true if this glass pane is blocking user input.
methods.name: isBusy
methods.comment: Returns true if this glass pane is blocking user input.

name: GGlassPane
comment:
A component that acts as the general purpose glass pane for Java windows.  This component allows
 Ghidra to easily change
